title: Scroll of destroy armor
data:
- *This article is about the scroll, which "destroy armor" redirects to. For the [monster spell](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell") that shares many similar messages, see [Destroy armor (monster spell)](/wiki/Destroy_armor_\(monster_spell\) "Destroy armor (monster spell)").*

| ? [![Scroll.png](/images/8/8d/Scroll.png)](/wiki/File:Scroll.png) |                                                               |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name                                                              | destroy armor                                                 |
| Appearance                                                        | [random](/wiki/Randomised_appearance "Randomised appearance") |
| Base price                                                        | 100 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                             |
| Weight                                                            | 5                                                             |
| Ink to write                                                      | [5-9](/wiki/Magic_marker "Magic marker")                      |
| Monster use                                                       | *Will not be used by monsters.*                               |

A **scroll of destroy armor** is a type of [scroll](/wiki/Scroll "Scroll") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. The [random label](/wiki/Randomized_appearance "Randomized appearance") [associated with it](/wiki/Scroll_origins "Scroll origins") in [objects.c](/wiki/Objects.c "Objects.c") is JUYED AWK YACC.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Description](#Description)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [3 History](#History)
- [4 Messages](#Messages)
- [5 xNetHack](#xNetHack)
- [6 References](#References)

## Description

Reading the scroll of destroy armor will destroy one piece of worn armor. The scroll chooses at random which piece of armor will be affected. If any armor is worn on the torso, only the outermost worn layer of cloak, body armor, or shirt is eligible.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

If a cursed scroll targets cursed armor in this way, it [stuns](/wiki/Stun "Stun") you for 10-19 turns and lowers that armor's [enchantment](/wiki/Enchantment "Enchantment") by one (unless it is at -7) instead of destroying it.

If you read the scroll while you are not wearing armor, your [strength](/wiki/Strength "Strength") and [constitution](/wiki/Constitution "Constitution") are abused. If you are not a [beginner](/wiki/Beginner "Beginner"), the scroll will be identified - otherwise, "[you have a strange feeling for a moment, then it passes](/wiki/You_have_a_strange_feeling_for_a_moment,_then_it_passes "You have a strange feeling for a moment, then it passes")".

Reading a non-cursed scroll while confused removes erodeproofing on a piece of armor, targeted in the same way as above - reading a cursed scroll while confused instead *applies* erodeproofing a piece of armor, but does not repair it if damaged the way reading a [scroll of enchant armor](/wiki/Scroll_of_enchant_armor "Scroll of enchant armor") while confused does.

## Strategy

The scroll of destroy armor is a typical example of what makes randomly read-testing scrolls a [bad idea](/wiki/Bad_idea "Bad idea") without identifying it beforehand in some manner. In terms of [price identification](/wiki/Price_identification "Price identification"), it costs the same base price as the [scroll of fire](/wiki/Scroll_of_fire "Scroll of fire"), which is similarly (if not more) perilous to a random scroll reader. Wearing only non-cursed disposable armor makes this scroll safer to read and identify - while wearing none at all will also identify it through its unique message, this may be less preferable depending on how willing to tolerate stat abuse you are at that point.

However, intentionally reading a noncursed scroll can reliably destroy cursed pieces of armor when done after removing all other armor. The confused effect of reading a cursed scroll is also useful for protecting armor - though it does not repair damage, it allows you to save the latter scrolls for actual enchantments if you are only erodeproofing. Writing the cursed scroll with a [magic marker](/wiki/Magic_marker "Magic marker") can also save ink compared to scrolls of enchant armor.

## History

The scroll of destroy armor has been present in the game since the first version of [Hack](/wiki/Hack "Hack").

## Messages

- Your cloak crumbles and turns to dust!  
  Your armor turns to dust and falls to the \<floor>!  
  Your shirt crumbles into tiny threads and falls apart!  
  Your helmet turns to dust and is blown away!  
  Your gloves vanish!  
  Your boots disintegrate!  
  Your shield crumbles away!

  One of your worn pieces of armor was destroyed from reading the scroll.

- Your \<armor> vibrates.

  You read a cursed scroll of destroy armor and it targeted a piece of cursed armor you were wearing.

- Your skin itches.

  You read the scroll while wearing no armor.

- Your bones itch.

  As above while confused.

- Your \<armor> glows purple for a moment.

  You read the scroll while confused.

- Your \<armor> vibrates for a moment.

  As above, while also blind.

## xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), reading the blessed scroll of destroy armor allows you to select which piece of armor to destroy.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/objects.c in NetHack 3.6.6, line 829](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.6_Released/src/objects.c#L829)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/do\_wear.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 2241](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/do_wear.c#L2241): *function some\_armor*

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.6. Click here for more information.](/images/5/57/Nh366-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.6. Click here for more information.")
html:
Scroll of destroy armor

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
This article is about the scroll, which "destroy armor" redirects to. For the monster spell that shares many similar messages, see Destroy armor (monster spell).
?
Name destroy armor
Appearance random
Base price 100 zm
Weight 5
Ink to write 5-9
Monster use Will not be used by monsters.

A scroll of destroy armor is a type of scroll that appears in NetHack. The random label associated with it in objects.c is JUYED AWK YACC.[1]

Contents

  • 1 Description
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 History
  • 4 Messages
  • 5 xNetHack
  • 6 References

Description

Reading the scroll of destroy armor will destroy one piece of worn armor. The scroll chooses at random which piece of armor will be affected. If any armor is worn on the torso, only the outermost worn layer of cloak, body armor, or shirt is eligible.[2]

If a cursed scroll targets cursed armor in this way, it stuns you for 10-19 turns and lowers that armor's enchantment by one (unless it is at -7) instead of destroying it.

If you read the scroll while you are not wearing armor, your strength and constitution are abused. If you are not a beginner, the scroll will be identified - otherwise, "you have a strange feeling for a moment, then it passes".

Reading a non-cursed scroll while confused removes erodeproofing on a piece of armor, targeted in the same way as above - reading a cursed scroll while confused instead applies erodeproofing a piece of armor, but does not repair it if damaged the way reading a scroll of enchant armor while confused does.

Strategy

The scroll of destroy armor is a typical example of what makes randomly read-testing scrolls a bad idea without identifying it beforehand in some manner. In terms of price identification, it costs the same base price as the scroll of fire, which is similarly (if not more) perilous to a random scroll reader. Wearing only non-cursed disposable armor makes this scroll safer to read and identify - while wearing none at all will also identify it through its unique message, this may be less preferable depending on how willing to tolerate stat abuse you are at that point.

However, intentionally reading a noncursed scroll can reliably destroy cursed pieces of armor when done after removing all other armor. The confused effect of reading a cursed scroll is also useful for protecting armor - though it does not repair damage, it allows you to save the latter scrolls for actual enchantments if you are only erodeproofing. Writing the cursed scroll with a magic marker can also save ink compared to scrolls of enchant armor.

History

The scroll of destroy armor has been present in the game since the first version of Hack.

Messages

Your cloak crumbles and turns to dust!
Your armor turns to dust and falls to the <floor>!
Your shirt crumbles into tiny threads and falls apart!
Your helmet turns to dust and is blown away!
Your gloves vanish!
Your boots disintegrate!
Your shield crumbles away!
One of your worn pieces of armor was destroyed from reading the scroll.
Your <armor> vibrates.
You read a cursed scroll of destroy armor and it targeted a piece of cursed armor you were wearing.
Your skin itches.
You read the scroll while wearing no armor.
Your bones itch.
As above while confused.
Your <armor> glows purple for a moment.
You read the scroll while confused.
Your <armor> vibrates for a moment.
As above, while also blind.

xNetHack

In xNetHack, reading the blessed scroll of destroy armor allows you to select which piece of armor to destroy.

References

  1. ↑ src/objects.c in NetHack 3.6.6, line 829
  2. ↑ src/do_wear.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 2241: function some_armor
